column4: I'm going to be running a script.  I want to ensure that the script doesn't have any access to my files or the shared files on the local network.  How would I do this?
run it as its own user without specific priviledges and use a sandbox(chroot/apparmor or mac like selinux)
Ah, so it isn't just a quick fix...  All right, thanks.
well creating an apparmor provile wich doesnt allow anything is pretty easy
Installing and setting up the program is the problem.  I don't use Linux usually.  The only reason I have it installed is because I don't have another copy of XP :S
